title: D. melanogaster F1 F2 generations 5 options 2

content.description: A male fruit fly (Drosophila melanogaster) with red eyes and long wings was mated with a female with purple eyes and vestigial wings. All of the offspring in the F1 generation had red eyes and long wings. These F1 flies were test crossed with purple-eyed, vestigial-winged flies. Their offspring, the F2 generation, appeared as indicated below.
content.question: In the F2 generation, the results are best explained by the fact that

choices.label: the test cross with the F1 flies resulted in sterile offspring
these genes for eye color and wing shape do not pass through the F1 generation
these genes for eye color and wing shape are found on the same chromosome

content.answer: these genes for eye color and wing shape are found on the same chromosome

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
